Wenlu Du

Assistant Professor, Computer Science · Skidmore College

My research focuses on reinforcement learning for intelligent transportation systems, with an emphasis on traffic safety. My broader interests span applied AI in transportation, finance, and video games, as well as large language models and robotics.

I earned my Ph.D. from NJIT, advised by Prof. Jing Li and Prof. Guiling Wang. Previously, I was a software engineer at Alpine Electronics of America.

Reinforcement Learning Traffic Safety Applied AI LLMs Robotics
Research Publications Teaching CV Contact

News & Updates

2025 Apr Our paper "PairUpLight: A Multi-agent Reinforcement Learning Approach for Coordinated Multi-intersection Traffic Signal Control" is accepted to IEEE International Conference on Distributed Computing Systems (ICDCS '25).
2025 Feb I'm honored to be one of five recipients of Skidmore College's Faculty Research Initiative Grant.
2025 Feb Our paper "RAGIC: Risk-Aware Generative Framework for Stock Interval Construction" is accepted to IEEE Transactions on Knowledge and Data Engineering (TKDE '25).
2023 Oct Our paper "Margin Trader: A Reinforcement Learning Framework for Portfolio Management with Margin and Constraints" is accepted to 4th ACM International Conference on AI in Finance (ICAIF '23).
2023 Aug Our paper "Safety in Traffic Management Systems: A Comprehensive Survey" is accepted to Designs 7, no. 4 (2023).
2023 Feb I am pleased to serve as a VP for ACM-W NJIT.
2023 Feb Presented our paper "SafeLight: A Reinforcement Learning Method toward Collision-Free Traffic Signal Control" at AAAI 2023, Washington, DC, USA.
2022 Nov Our paper "SafeLight: A Reinforcement Learning Method toward Collision-free Traffic Signal Control" is accepted to AAAI 2023!
2022 Aug I have successfully defended my proposal on "Reinforcement Learning for Intelligent Transportation Systems".
